trans-unit.source: A binding used to configure endpoints for Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) Web services that are exposed through HTTP requests instead of SOAP messages.

The [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] Web Programming Model allows developers to expose [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] Web services through HTTP requests that use "plain old XML" (POX) style messaging instead of SOAP-based messaging.

For clients to communicate with a service using HTTP requests, an endpoint of the service must be configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> that has the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior> attached to it.

The WCF Web Programming Model also requires that the individual service operations are annotated with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> attributes.
This defines a mapping from a URI and HTTP method to the service operation, as well as the format of the messages used to call the operation and return the results.
Support in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] for syndication and ASP.AJAX integration are both built on top of the WCF Web Programming Model.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding"></xref> class.
The default security mode is <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.None>, which specifies that no security is used.

To use transport-level security for endpoints configured with this binding, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.Transport> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.

To use HTTP authentication without HTTPS, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding"></xref> class with the type of security used by the binding explicitly specified.

To use transport-level security for endpoints configured with this binding, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.Transport> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.

To use HTTP authentication without HTTPS, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly> value must be specified as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.
The mode specified is not a valid .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding"></xref> class with a binding specified by its configuration name.
The binding configuration name for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WebHttpBindingElement"></xref>.
The binding element with the name configurationName was not found.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the client accepts cookies and propagates them on future requests.
This property is provided as a convenience for using cookies included in HTTP headers.
When cookies are accepted by the client by setting the property to `true`, cookies returned from the server are automatically copied to all future client requests to that service.
`true` if cookies are allowed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Builds the channel factory stack on the client that creates a specified type of channel and that satisfies the features specified by a collection of binding parameters.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingParameterCollection"></xref> that specifies requirements for the channel factory built.
The type of channel the channel factory produces.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory`1"></xref> of type TChannel that satisfies the features specified by the collection.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to bypass the proxy server for local addresses.
An Internet resource is local if it has a local address.
A local address is one that is on same computer, the local LAN or intranet and is identified, syntactically, by the lack of a period (.) as in the URIs "http://webserver/" and "http://localhost/".

Setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal%2A> property determines whether endpoints configured with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> use the proxy server when accessing local resources.
If <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal%2A> is `true`, requests to local Internet resources do not use the proxy server.
When <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.BypassProxyOnLocal%2A> is `false`, all Internet requests are made through the proxy server.
`true` to bypass the proxy server for local addresses; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the content type mapper.
The content type mapper.
Returns an ordered collection of binding elements contained in the current binding.
The order of the binding elements is important.
It reflects the order in which the protocol and transport channels are constructed and stacked.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElementCollection"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement"></xref> objects for the binding.
Gets or sets a value that determines if cross domain script access is enabled.
`true` if cross domain scripting is enabled; otherwise `false`.
Gets the envelope version that is used by endpoints that are configured by this binding to receive HTTP requests.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion"></xref> with the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion.None"></xref> property that is used with endpoints configured with this binding to receive HTTP requests.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the hostname is used to reach the service when matching the URI.

The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WSDualHttpBindingElement.HostNameComparisonMode"></xref> value that indicates whether the hostname is used to reach the service when matching on the URI.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.HostNameComparisonMode.StrongWildcard"></xref>, which ignores the hostname in the match.
The value set is not a valid <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Configuration.WSDualHttpBindingElement.HostNameComparisonMode"></xref> value.
Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory allocated, in bytes, for the buffer manager that manages the buffers required by endpoints that use this binding.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> tries to minimize the cost of using buffers with a buffer pool.
Buffers are required to process messages by the service when they come out of the channel.

If there is not sufficient memory in the buffer pool to process the message load, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> must allocate additional memory from the CLR heap, which increases the garbage collection overhead.

Extensive allocation from the CLR garbage heap is an indication that the buffer pool size is too small and that performance can be improved with a larger allocation by increasing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A> limit.
The maximum size, in bytes, for the pool of buffers used by an endpoint configured with this binding.
The default value is 65,536 bytes.
Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory, in bytes, that is allocated for use by the manager of the message buffers that receive messages from the channel.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> minimizes the cost of using buffers by using a buffer pool.
Buffers are required to process messages by the service when they come out of the channel.

If there is not sufficient memory in the buffer pool to process the message load, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager> must allocate additional memory from the CLR heap, which increases the garbage collection overhead.

Extensive allocation from the CLR garbage heap is an indication that the buffer pool size is too small and that performance can be improved with a larger allocation by increasing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpBinding.MaxBufferPoolSize%2A> limit.
The maximum amount of memory, in bytes, available for use by the message buffer manager.
The default value is 524,288 (0x80000) bytes.
The value set is less than or equal to zero.
Gets or sets the maximum size, in bytes, for a message that can be processed by the binding.
The size of the messages that can be received on the wire by services using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> is bounded by the amount of memory allocated for each message.
This bound on message size is intended to limit exposure to denial of service (DoS) attacks.
The maximum size, in bytes, for a message that is processed by the binding.
The default value is 65,536 bytes.
The value is less than zero.
A message exceeded the maximum size allocated.
Gets or sets the URI address of the HTTP proxy.
If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.UseDefaultWebProxy%2A> is set to `true`, the value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.ProxyAddress%2A> is ignored.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that serves as the address of the HTTP proxy.
The default value is `null`.
Gets or sets constraints on the complexity of SOAP messages that can be processed by endpoints configured with this binding.
The complexity constraints protect against a class of denial of service (DOS) attacks that attempt to use message complexity to tie up endpoint processing resources.
The properties that express these constraints and their default values (in bytes) are as follows:
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxDepth%2A> = 32
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength%2A> = 8192
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength%2A> = 16384
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxBytesPerRead%2A> = 4096
<xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxNameTableCharCount%2A> = 16384
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> that specifies the complexity constraints.
The value set is `null`.
The quota values of <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> are read only.
The quotas set must be positive.
Gets the URI transport scheme for the channels and listeners that are configured with this binding.

"https" if the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.Security"></xref> is set to <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.Transport"></xref>; "http" if it is set to <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.None"></xref>.
Gets the security settings used with this binding.
To use a non-default type of security, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> constructor.
If you set this property to <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly> and you are using HTTP, be aware that credentials are sent over the wire in plain text.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity"></xref> that is used with this binding.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode.None"></xref>.
Determines if reader quotas should be serialized.
`true` if reader quotas should be serialized; otherwise `false`.
Determines if security settings should be serialized.
`true` if security settings should be serialized; otherwise `false`.
Determines if the encoding used for serialization should be serialized.
`true` if the encoding should be serialized; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the service configured with the binding uses streamed or buffered (or both) modes of message transfer.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransferMode"></xref> value that indicates whether the service configured with the binding uses streamed or buffered (or both) modes of message transfer.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransferMode.Buffered"></xref>.
The value set is not a valid <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransferMode"></xref> value.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the auto-configured HTTP proxy of the system should be used, if available.
It is an error for this to be `true` and <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.ProxyAddress%2A> to be non-`null`.
`true` if the auto-configured HTTP proxy of the system should be used, if available; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets the character encoding that is used for the message text.
The <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref> that indicates the character encoding that is used.
The default is <xref href="System.Text.UTF8Encoding"></xref>.
The value set is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether incoming requests are handled synchronously or asynchronously.

This run-time behavior for receiving messages in either a service or client application can be changed using the [\<synchronousReceive\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/synchronousreceive-element.md).
`true` if incoming requests are handled synchronously; `false` if incoming requests are handled asynchronously.
The default value is `false`.
